## Steps to reproduce
1. Install Powershell Core from .pkg
2. run 'sudo pwsh' to run powershell as root
3. Try a Test-Connection to any IP address. 


## Expected behavior

```none
Test-Connection attempts to connect to the IP and returns the results of the connection attempt.
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68653255/88195958-a2bb1700-cc0e-11ea-9ace-57df88e34a73.png)

## Actual behavior
```none
Test-Connection errors instantly with the following error message and nothing is returned. Error is still instant even if a timeout is specified.
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68653255/88193169-59b59380-cc0b-11ea-8b23-b2b3cc2f02bb.png)

comments.body: Sounds like there might have been an issue in .NET core that has since been fixed? 🤔

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It comes from .Net. I do not think it makes sense to ask the fix for .Net 3 because we already moved to .Net 5.0. Also the cmdlet is an experimental and it is not ready for production (there are many other issues in the .Net API).
